answers.answer:
Dopomoha is a web support and information platform created for migrants fleeing the war in Ukraine. It provides reliable information on entry requirements, asylum procedures, rights, obligations, and useful resources for their stay in Romania.

To find more detailed information, please visit the Dopomoha website at https://dopomoha.ro/en/about and read the content under the "About" section.

answers.answer:
The Dopomoha platform is designed to help migrants fleeing the war in Ukraine, particularly those displaced in Romania. It provides them with essential information and support for safely entering and navigating their new reality in the country.

To find more detailed information, you can visit the Dopomoha website at https://dopomoha.ro/en/about and read the content under the "About" section.

answers.answer:
The Dopomoha platform provides reliable information on entry requirements at the Romanian border, procedures for seeking asylum, the rights and obligations of asylum seekers, and useful resources for their stay in Romania.

To find detailed information, please visit the Dopomoha website at dopomoha.ro and explore the various sections and categories provided on the platform, such as those related to entry, asylum, rights, and useful resources.

Code for Romania, the Department for Emergency Situations (DSU), The UN Refugee Agency, the International Organization for Migration (OIM), and the National Romanian Council for Refugees (CNRR) are partners in the Dopomoha project.

To find detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/about and look under the "About" section.
